title: Test
yAxis: Budget balance in relation to GDP
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Budget balance in relation to GDP, with a total of 11 data points.
Overall Budget balance in relation to GDP has increased over the Year

Budget balance in relation to GDP is rapidly increasing from 2008 to 2009, gradually decreasing from 2009 to 2010, rapidly increasing from 2010 to 2011, gradually constant from 2011 to 2013, gradually increasing from 2013 to 2014, gradually decreasing from 2014 to 2015, roughly constant from 2015 to 2016, and lastly rapidly increasing from 2016 to 2018.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2017 and 2018.
Max Budget balance in relation to GDP about 30.56 was recorded at Year 2018
Min Budget balance in relation to GDP about 3.46 was recorded at Year 2008
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Budget balance in relation to GDP, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 4 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2010 to 2014.
Similarly, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2015 to 2018.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2008 to 2010.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2014 to 2015.
